result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse W Meyer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With Huber if imposed.
Consecutive to: Case 14CM1564

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions.

No Violent Contact with Dyllan M. or Meghann C. or their residence unless approved by agent. Cases 15CM417 & 15CM416 were dismissed and read in.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. STAYED - for use at agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt: Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
filed by the state

Defendant Jesse W Meyer in court with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Perkins makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  IMPOSED AND STAYED SENTENCE OF:   

90 DAYS HUBER (CREDIT - _ days)             **CONSECUTIVE TO CASE #14CM1564**

TERM OF PROBATION: 18 MONTHS    

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____No violent contact with Dyllan M. or Meghann C. or their residence unless approved by agent 

COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid out of cash bail posted on this case and remainder returned to poster)

CONDITION TIME:   30 Days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions - STAYED - to be used at agent's discretion
Sentencing hearing on June 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.  **no paper copy in physical file**

Defendant Jesse W Meyer in court with Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.  Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in. Attorney Perkins requests a sentencing date.    Bail remains as fixed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Hearing on June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness listed in the Criminal Complaint or their residence.

Defendant Jesse W Meyer in court with attorney Nicole Masnica for attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Defendant allowed 2 non collect phone calls.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Case called at 8:55 a.m. Attorney Clarice Rosa Perkins in court.   Defendant Jesse W Meyer did not appear.   Jayne Davis Dewire appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for plea and sentence hearing, however Defendant does not appear.  State does not object to a stayed capias.  Court issues a capias.  No action taken on bail.
Hearing on February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to have no contact with victim/witness or their residence listed in the Criminal Complaint.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Jesse W Meyer in court, in custody, with attorney J Anthony Rosario.   Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT. Defendant allowed non collect calls. 
  Hearing scheduled for February 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
